website_summaries.verdict: These arm floats fit older todders and preschoolers best and are recommended for children already learning to swim.
pros: Recommended for children already familiar with the water
Bands fit children ages two to 12
Kid-friendly shape for comfort and mobility
One-way valve means air doesn't leak when you stop inflating
cons: May be difficult to blow up
Bands fit children around age three best

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren were coming to visit, and in anticipation of taking them swimming i bought these arm bands. The product was as expected, but i had not done my homework. The people in charge of the pool did not allow arm bands as they considered them unsafe. Instead they had jackets available for children to use freely. Although there was no defect, it seems this is simply not a product one should be using - something i was not aware of. It is rated 3 stars for meeting quality standards, while losing two stars for being an unusable product, and obviously if it cannot be used the value for money is zero.
customer_reviews.author: Free Man

customer_reviews.title: Two year old sank!
customer_reviews.text: My two year old wore these floaties for his first swim lesson and he just sank. He weighs 36 piundw which is way less than max weight on the description for these floaties. We went and bought some for $3 at Target and they work perfect! I would return to amazon but threw away the packaging because I was confident in this speedo brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! My 6 year old was using some cheap plastic ones and they were so hard to get on and off without feeling like her skin was being ripped off. We decided to try these and they completely solved that issue. My only complaint is that they are a little hard to inflate. You have to stick the entire thing in your mouth and bite down in order to get air in there, but once you get that figured out it doesnt take much to fill them up. I would definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Helps to stay afloat
customer_reviews.text: We had used swimming arm bands before, and they made our child feel safe. So, as he grows and continues to learn to swim, he has been using the Speedo Kids Begin to Swim Basic Arm Bands. The quality is good, and they stay inflated without any problem. recommend these. Try to get the arms wet to ease up the sliding of the bands. Once in place complete their inflation. Do not put too much air on them as this can hurt the kids's arm - think of it as your car tire having too much pressure: not good!
customer_reviews.author: Azulciel

customer_reviews.title: Happy babies, Happy Mama
customer_reviews.text: Struggled to find something my 2 year old twins wouldn’t ask to take off as soon as they got in the water. These were it! They feel supported enough to float next to us without needing to be held. They’re exploring how to move their arms and legs without being as restricted as some other options we tried. These were so cheap I bought a couple more sets for grandparents to keep too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kristin anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my children and they are awesome! My son is 50lbs and they completely keep him afloat - I wasn't sure that they would. My daughter is only 30lbs and these are too big for her tiny arms. Unfortunately she'll prob need to wait until next summer to wear them. Blowing them up is a little difficult - you have to find just the right way to squeeze the valve to blow them up. The fabric is soft so it doesn't irritate their skin or anything.
customer_reviews.author: K. Motes

customer_reviews.title: Save your money buy the plastic ones from the grocery store!
customer_reviews.text: I have not been disappointed in an amazon purchase like I have this one. My daughter wore these for less than an hour and they started to not stay on. After looking more closely they have begun to come apart. Buy the cheap plastic ones for $1.50 at the grocery store and save your money. We had to buy those because these ripped so you might as well skip these altogether.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Hard to blow up
customer_reviews.text: While the swimmies themselves seem to be made well, getting them to inflate was a different story. The holes were not fully punctured so we had to poke something in the outlet to be able to blow them up. Once we did inflate them, however, they have worked really well. They give my kids the extra confidence they need to swim anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Not great!
customer_reviews.text: This were extremely hard to blow up. It took three of us to get these to blow up. Once the were inflated they wouldn’t go on my daughter’s arm. She’s 5 and still has a hard time swimming and we figured these would be safe just in case of anything. The price is good but be prepared to work for that money!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my 6 year old to use in our unground pool. She is able to swim without them okay but they are a must for going past were she can touch the bottom. They give her added confidence of swimming further and longer while keeping her head above water. She sometimes will swim in the shallow end with just one on to help practice. They stay inflated, even when left outside. Easy for her to put on and take if on her own. Overally very happy with how they have held up
customer_reviews.author: Car

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed that i spent the money on these when the ones i got from the dollar store lasted longer. My daughter was able to use these 2x before a small hole appeared in one of the water wings. I patched it and then the next time we swam the opposite one looked deflated and i found another hole. They went in the trash after that. Super cute, but just go buy a cheap pair. I have had the same cheap pair for 4 months with not a single issue.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie jones

customer_reviews.title: Large arm openings for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a 3 y/o after the plastic ones ripped at the seam underarm. The cloth is nice and they inflate easily. My only concern is the hole in which the arm rests is quite large. Easy to take off and no issue with them falling off while in the pool in spite of the extra room. While she is out of the water they slip down her arm, which annoys her, she’s used to the plastic version staying on the upper arm. As always, use with care and supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahfunah

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My kids wore these all summer without any complaints. These floaties did't get any holes in them, and we were in our pool pretty regularly throughout the summer. They fit well and according to my kids, they were very comfortable. There was never any issue with them falling off either, and my children were constantly jumping into our pool. Great value for the price, and I plan to use them next summer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Clevenger

customer_reviews.title: Not made for kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a 4 year old girl that is 42” tall and weighs 36 pounds. It doesn’t fit!! EXTREMELY too big for her arms. Falls right off. If the bottom part also blew up it would be a different review. Gave 3 stars because they seem very well made for a big enough kid and I like the material around the plastic, BUT there is no way these can fit a 2-12 year old as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Trina  Peddicord

customer_reviews.title: Heads Up - Ripped after 2 wears
customer_reviews.text: These worked great until they ripped on the second day worn. There were 2 days in between and I deflated and put them away out of the sun. I plan on reaching out to Speedo for replacement but not too pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Erica D.

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you are lookong for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the same reason your looking for them. The fabric cover is far more comfortable than just having the inflatable with the seam directly against the kid's skin. They are built well and my son enjoys them.
customer_reviews.author: Joewldct

customer_reviews.title: Child did not trust them to carry his weight
customer_reviews.text: My son did not enjoy this product. They seemed to limit the ability of his range of motion in the water, but that's obvious because of the placement on the upper arms. I think he also likes the security of a life jacket because it's all encompassing, he didn't really trust these floaties were going to carry his weight. It all comes down to your child's preference. It may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy expensive ones. These are perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Work perfect on my 4 year old. He can jump in the pool by himself, go under and float right back up, can basically do anything on his own with these. Jumping in over and over and not once did they slip off. Squeeze the little hole to blow up, takes 2 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: great floaties, very confortable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot better than the regular floaties. The cloth added extra confort and it is so worth the extra money. For the firat time my son had no marks on his arms. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: One more customer

customer_reviews.title: Medium quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for summer swimming. Better quality then Walmart ones, but by the end of the summer one of floaters was just barely starting to rip at the seam. Also the last time he wore them they started slipping off my 3 year olds arm. Not sure why suddenly that happened, but obviously not what you want to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Dosa

customer_reviews.title: Durable!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these water wings. Most durable ones I have found so far! We have traveled all over and not had a single issue with them! I have 4 year old boy/girl twins that are two different sizes and they work perfect for both.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: The directions tell you to squeeze the valve gently and blow to inflate. When you do this, nothing happens. The air has no way to enter the chamber, so I’m unable to inflate them at all. Garbage. I bought them to take on vacation because they pack so small, however, I wish I would have attempted to inflate them before we left because now I have to go find something else for my kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: PGMama

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these swimmies, she was always complaining about the puddle jumper style that her arms went through and went across her chest. That stile also would irritate her skin. After putting these on she was in the water instantly swimming and having fun. Additionally they deflate flat for easy packing in luggage when you travel
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Floaties
customer_reviews.text: We used these for our 4 and 5 year olds and they worked perfectly all summer. We left them inflated all summer and they didn't deflate at all. The kids never had red marks from them rubbing and never complained about wearing them. I'm satisfied with this purchase and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Fit and worked well after replaced due to leak
customer_reviews.text: Had to request a new pair as 1 bladder had a leak. Amazon sent a new set out next day and they work gone. Fit my 5 year old 40 pound granddaughter
customer_reviews.author: Trina  Peddicord

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is sensitive to fabrics and hates the plastic feel of most arm floaties. These were fun color and super comfortable for her. They work great for floating. It took a second to figure out how to inflate them, but they were easy enough once I figured out how to depress the valve.
customer_reviews.author: EKBVS

customer_reviews.title: Air leaked
customer_reviews.text: I found that the air slightly leaked over time during a long day of swimming. It still held an adequate amount of air to keep my child afloat, but not sure if this is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Josh A

customer_reviews.title: worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan of the plastic type material, but they worked fine. My grandson said it was much easier swimming in the pool without a life jacket wrapped around his head. He is 85 lbs. and held him up fine. We did have to leave some air out to put on his chunky arms.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie C.

customer_reviews.title: Seem well made
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old grandson has autism and is leary of the water. Tried these “floaties” and he was eager to go into the pool. Now he’s slowly gaining confidence in the water and slowly beginning to learn how to swim. Seem very well made compared to some others I’ve seen. Would highly recommend these
customer_reviews.author: D. K.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical before buying these because of the bad reviews. They are MUCH better than the cheap brand we have been using. They aren’t difficult to blow up as I saw in a previous review, you just have to bite down like every other product these days! It’s for your convenience. Be mindful that there are TWO spots to blow these up at. One for each side. My son loves them! They are extremely durable, comfortable, and keep my 6 year old afloat. If you are using these properly there is NO reason for your child to completely sink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our kiddos love them!
customer_reviews.text: These things are the bomb. For a summer full of swimming these are perfect to prevent those rashes and scratches that come from all-plastic ones. Got two pairs, both have been inflated and deflated multiple times, used for hours, and have really held up. Literally - ha! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the $5. So far my daughter loves them, no leaks or tears, way worth buying over the dollar store kind. Bought some from the dollar store and they lasted less than a day. These have lasted several weeks so far and are easy to get on and off and refill with air. We bought them so she will get more comfortable without the puddle jumper...so far so good. Bought another pair for my son.
customer_reviews.author: MR13

customer_reviews.title: Super floaties
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable and will last many years our daughter is now 5 years old we bought these for her two years ag and now she swims without them but we keep them for friends that come to our pool. Two uears of heavy use in florida and they still look and work like new.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hamby

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 4 year old. He uses them a lot and doesn’t complain. Soft fabric wrap that can be removed and washed. Recommend not wearing at the beach. Sand gets caught in them and weighs them down...like swim trunks...they fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Can't blow these up and they do not have an adjustable strap so they can slip right off. Set for ages 2-12 I don't know how the isn't something to adjust the size. The fabric ones from Walmart for half the price are better than these. Really disappointed bc I bought 2 pair expecting they'd be great and threw the packages away.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are great swimmies. My daughter is 78 lbs and they definitely keep her a float! I read all the negative reviews about not thinking they would even hold a child up over 30 lbs. I decided to check it out myself...they definitely do their job! Best quality is they stay inflated great! And don't pull on the skin to put on or take off!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. It came with a huge hole in one.
customer_reviews.author: Kyliegh Romine

customer_reviews.title: Do not a work well at all
customer_reviews.text: These are supposed to be for kids. Well my son almost drowned thanks to these. Inflated to full size and couldnt keep him up. A 50 pound kid. Had to have water maneuvered out of his lungs. Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: Lea McNoldy

customer_reviews.title: Fabric covered so you kids don't have to deal with plastic rubbing them
customer_reviews.text: They were easy enought to inflate, it is the valve you have to pinch. Not a big deal and I appreciate that this helps them stay inflated. My nephew came to visit and needed a little help in the pool at times. These slipped on his 6 year old arms well and were totally comfortable for him to use and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits well for older children
customer_reviews.text: These fit great. My daughter doesn’t have a lot of confidence yet in the water. She’s 7 and very slender arms and these fit great. Also helped her build her confidence and skills learning to swim
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great floaties!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the fabric floaties for my newly 6 year old son who has worn a puddle jumper since he was a little toddler. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but these are awesome. There are 2 inflatable bladders on each one and the fabric doesn’t pull or rip his skin. He was swimming for hours and didn’t complain once and they kept him perfectly upright and safe. Awesome product, just ordered another set for my daughter for next summer when she outgrows her puddle jumper!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly B

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: These are OK for the price, but don't lady long. Floaties start falling apart after a few uses. Went through two sets in one summer with moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Odessit

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to inflate
customer_reviews.text: My son likes these, but it was really hard to inflate. If you have braces, have someone else do it. Can't speak to the durability as we have only used once, but the quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to inflate
customer_reviews.text: Who knows how well these work or how comfortable they are. I about passed out trying to inflate these things. So, I'm returning them.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: These will sink!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2.5 years old and these arm bands doesn’t hold him up in the pool. He’s been using similar arm bands even when he was younger but this never happened. Invest in a better quality. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: No ouchies!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these. The traditional plastic ones were "too pinchy" on her and she wouldn't wear them or would complain. It put a big damper on pool time. These are soft go on easy but don't slip off even when she jumps in. They are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: Way too big
customer_reviews.text: These are way too big for my larger than average 3 year old. I suspect my child will be swimming independently before these fit. They appear to be well made and the fabric cover is nice. I suspect they would work well for a larger child.
customer_reviews.author: Umwari

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Comfortable! Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I had to have my husband blow these up as I was unable to, my husband had no problem inflating them though. These worked soooo well for my 60 pound child. He felt so comfortable in the water with these.
customer_reviews.author: Max's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great balue
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Already have many uses. Both my kids are already excelling in swimming. Prefer these over the full body swimmers Because of the ability to move.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Durable. We use them often. Stylish. My grandson is 5 years old and loves it
customer_reviews.author: marycellys

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to blow up
customer_reviews.text: These are very hard to blow up and I have no idea why. I even tried an electric blower and they still wouldn't blow up. Eventually my dad got them to take in air, but arm floats should not be difficult to blow up. I don't want to let the air out of them because I don't know if I'll be able to blow them up again. I wouldn't buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn R

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but not for a skinny child.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in addition to inflatable vest. It fits right For 2 yo but if the child’s hands are skinnier than usual it comes off in the water.
customer_reviews.author: I. Li

customer_reviews.title: Worked great ONCE!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these and they worked great for the first time my son wore them... but the second time we used them one side of the float is leaking air and will not hold my son up anymore!!! Not happy and would like a replacement...
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to inflate
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for vacation for my 4 year old since they were packable. The material felt nice and my son liked the colors. I should have tried them before going. I was unable to inflate these whatsoever. I want to return them and then COVID 19 hit and I forgot about it, but just saw a prompt in my email asking about a review.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any little mermaid.
customer_reviews.text: Used almost daily with the warm weather. No fading or damage showing from drying in the sun. Love these "wings" second pair. First pair is about 4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: teresa

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! Tried the rest, this is the best!
customer_reviews.text: We tried several brands and either they were defective or failed quickly. These last! The pockets will trap sand at the beach so double check before you get home and pour a bunch of sand out on your floor, lol
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Very durable.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My grandchild has worn them 5 or 6 times and has no problem staying afloat. At 52 pounds she has out grown her puddle jumper and these have been a great replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SPEEDO ALWAYS GREAT GEARS
customer_reviews.text: Is the second time I buy these arm bands. they're amazing ans my son is really in love with them! The fabric cover makes them soft! Strongly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DORA KOVACS

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with the decent quality for the price. It surved the purpose and my kid lived it
customer_reviews.author: Omar - NJ

customer_reviews.title: Best floaties !
customer_reviews.text: Nice cloth cover makes them super comfy. Fits my skinny 7 year old perfectly. Taught her to swim in only a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great for little swimmers
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my grandson. Easy to inflate and much better for his skin. No under arm irritation
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Best design
customer_reviews.text: We buy a new pit of floaties every month or so due to our dog getting them and have tried many until this one. Now I just order these as their the best.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Was worried my son wouldn't like these, as he was switching from a chest ...
customer_reviews.text: Was worried my son wouldn't like these, as he was switching from a chest floaty thing. But he put them on and was excited. They keep him afloat, but he has to try harder than with the big chest deal. But he loves them and they work. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best ones to get off and on!!! They are also the only ones I have found that hold past a 50lb child.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Good but..
customer_reviews.text: Very cute! They work as they should and somewhat easier to get on and off than the plastic ones. The did leave an awful rash on my daughters arms, and we had to take them off. She has sensitive skin sometimes, so I wasn't sure if I should just chalk it up to that, or the material.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: A basic buy
customer_reviews.text: Said to be soft but these are plastic and have sharp edges. Most effective with small arms.
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill and work great.
customer_reviews.text: Use these for our 4 year old, and they work great. Decent quality, and fill super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Coffin

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite arm bands. They fit well and they’re pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: MicheleH

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Held air well, no leaks. Fabric cover makes them easy to take off and put on, but they don’t slide off either. Stay on securely during swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too difficult to inrflate
customer_reviews.text: Unable to use this product tried multiple ways to inflate as instructed but not even able to use
customer_reviews.author: Mary Peco Ramos

customer_reviews.title: For bigger kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my five yr old granddaughter but they are way,way too big for her,they are good quality,almost impossible to blow up
customer_reviews.author: lgw1954

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Just what we expected! Their comfortable and easy to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Foreman

customer_reviews.title: A huge asset in learning how to swim.
customer_reviews.text: Really helped my six year olds confidence and ability to learn how to swim.
customer_reviews.author: Dave’s not home

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these!
customer_reviews.text: These floats are high quality and comfortable for my grandsons. In fact, the boys didn’t want to take them off when they got out of the water. They just love wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: These swimmies are perfect for my almost 5 year old. He's learning how to swim but still needs some help. These provide just the right amount of assistance and also boost his confidence. They are very difficult to inflate but we just wiggle his arms in and out.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great Floaties
customer_reviews.text: Good product and great prices. Gives my little swimmer the freedom to enjoy the pool and keeps his head above water perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: My son loves these!!
customer_reviews.text: You really gotta squeeze the air valves to blow them up but they also don't leak air when you let go to close them. The covers come off for easy washing and the fabric is super stretchy and comfortable on my son's arms. Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Johnson

customer_reviews.title: second pair
customer_reviews.text: The first pair ended up being no good after only a few uses. The part that seals the air stopper tore and was unusable. The second pair seems to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: KCon

customer_reviews.title: Safety and comfort for little ones in water!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Used for 2 yr. Old twins. Softer than vinyl. Comfy for kids. No sticky and sweaty from vinyl types.
customer_reviews.author: jg in fl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality doesn't seem thwy would fit a 12 year old.
customer_reviews.author: lisa m schumann

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and really secure. Great fabric and quality. My daughter is 63 lb and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie K

customer_reviews.title: Great for Children with Sensory Issues!
customer_reviews.text: These are soft and durable. The cloth pulls over the air-port, making sure there's no plastic rubbing on the child's arm. Great for children with sensory issues! Not only that, but they stay up on the arm without sliding down.
customer_reviews.author: Tawn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect floaties
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Fit perfectly, stay up on kiddo’s arms, and do not irritate his skin. Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Princess BoB

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 6-year-old son with autism. He is rather tall about 4'4" and 53 pounds and he has plenty of room to grow with them. I would not use them on a lighter child, but they are great for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well made but expensive compared to similar products
customer_reviews.text: It looks very well made and I expect it to last a long time. I found similar intex bands for $1.50 at our local big box. Even if you assume the quality is much better, ten times the price is hard to justify.
customer_reviews.author: AvaJ

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome, my son love it he feel like fish on the water
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for both 2yo or 4yo
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put in - high quality- great for getting my son used to the water. Both my 4yo and 2yo use them and stay afloat yet can move their arms freely to swim. Great for learning to swim - much better in my opinion than a puddle jumper that restricts their arm movement
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Veri was night fit.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. It claims to be up to 12 years old, but it is too tight for my 3 years old. I bought it because a friend has has one for his kid the same brand, but is quite bigger. I will keep looking for the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 6 year old grandson to use in our backyard pool. Great buy. Inflated after putting on his arms so that they were tight enough not to slip off. The outer material is well made and soft on his skin. Very comfortable and well made
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M Galione

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We switched from a puddle jumper to these because my 7 year old was getting too big. They work great and she feels comfortable wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Really hard to inflate
customer_reviews.text: So hard to inflate but they are cool and comfy
customer_reviews.author: Bad Chicken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Theswe aare perfect and comfortable, my granddaugter loves them and feels very safe.
customer_reviews.author: jerri C

customer_reviews.title: My kid is still alive
customer_reviews.text: The design is lame, but it's kept me from having to dive into that filthy public pool to save my kid. So... Yeah... Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Droste

customer_reviews.title: Good for little swimmers
customer_reviews.text: Work fine for my 3 and 6 yr old grandchildren, but sometimes the air valves poke out while in use. Way overpriced here. Tag states a much lower price than I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great for 5-6 year olds
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of a pain to inflate (you have to really hold or bite down at the same time as you’re blowing air)...but they are easy to take on and off. And my kids say they’re comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Liz B

customer_reviews.title: These are great floaties!
customer_reviews.text: Great floaties for our 4 year old grandkids who are learning to swim. Very durable and easy to get on and off!
customer_reviews.author: S. Trezise

customer_reviews.title: Solid swimmies!
customer_reviews.text: These are made well and seem more reliable than others I’ve purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Boxer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to inflate
customer_reviews.text: Unable to inflate. Bought for trip and they are extremely hard to get air into without help.
customer_reviews.author: Isle

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. So sturdy. They have a one way valve so the air you’ve just blown in doesn’t leak out when you pull your lips away. My grandson LOVED them.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works well at the pool
customer_reviews.text: These arm floaties fit on a 5 year old and worked well. They were easy to blow up and kept him afloat the entire pool time. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: PSUfan

product_meta.title: Speedo Kids' Begin to Swim Vinyl Basic Arm Bands
product_meta.description: Swim Level 2: Water Confidence These products provide the tools to build confidence for a child already familiar with the water and learning to swim. One Size: Ages 2-12 years / Max. Weight: 110 lbs. Dual chamber heavy duty inflatable arm band for added safety and durability. Soft polyester material provides added comfort. High visibility, bright inner fabric for increased pool safety.
feature_bullets: Swim Level 2: Water Confidence - These products provide the tools to build confidence for a child already familiar with the water and learning to swim
One Size: Ages 2-12 years / Max. Weight: 110 lbs
Dual chamber heavy duty inflatable arm band for added safety and durability
Updated kid-friendly shape for comfort and mobility
Great for helping young swimmers build confidence in the water
